tasks.title: Investigate semantic search relevance for domain-specific queries
tasks.description:
During dog-fooding, searching for 'security test fuzzing' returned staleness tests instead of actual security-related code. The search seems to weight common terms like 'test' too heavily.

Investigation areas:
- Query expansion may be pulling in too many generic terms
- TF-IDF weighting may not properly discount common programming terms
- Domain-specific boosting could improve relevance for security/testing queries

Related: The code_concepts.py has programming synonyms but may need security-specific terms.

Discovered during: Dog-fooding session 2025-12-14

tasks.title: Add memory document templates and CLI
tasks.description:
Create templates and CLI tooling for the text-as-memories system:

1. Memory entry template (memories/YYYY-MM-DD-topic.md)
2. Decision record template (decisions/adr-NNN-title.md)
3. Concept consolidation template (concepts/topic.md)

CLI commands:
- python scripts/new_memory.py 'What I learned today'
- python scripts/new_decision.py 'ADR: Choose X over Y'

Auto-populate:
- Date, tags placeholder, related links section
- Git author info
- Link to recent tasks

See: docs/text-as-memories.md for format reference

tasks.title: Index memories and decisions in semantic search
tasks.description:
Extend the codebase indexer to include memory documents:

1. Add samples/memories/ and samples/decisions/ to indexed paths
2. Add doc-type detection for memory vs decision vs concept docs
3. Apply appropriate boosting (decisions may be more authoritative)
4. Support [[wiki-link]] extraction for cross-references

Integration points:
- scripts/index_codebase.py: Add memory paths
- cortical/processor: Add memory-specific metadata
- scripts/search_codebase.py: Show memory type in results

Enables: Searching across code AND institutional knowledge

tasks.title: Auto-generate memory entries from completed tasks
tasks.description:
When a task is marked complete, offer to generate a memory entry:

1. Extract task title, description, retrospective
2. Create memory document with learnings
3. Link to related files from task context
4. Add tags from task category

Integration:
- TaskSession.complete_task() could trigger this
- Optional flag: --create-memory
- Template pulls from task retrospective field

Benefits:
- Captures learnings automatically
- Builds institutional memory from task work
- Creates searchable knowledge base

tasks.title: Add wiki-link cross-reference resolution
tasks.description:
Parse and resolve [[wiki-style]] links in memory documents:

1. Extract [[link]] patterns from markdown files
2. Resolve to actual file paths (fuzzy matching)
3. Build bidirectional link graph
4. Add 'backlinks' section showing what links TO a document

Use cases:
- [[concepts/pagerank.md]] resolves to actual path
- [[2025-12-14]] finds memory entries for that date
- Search results show connection strength via links

Implementation:
- Add link extraction to tokenizer or separate module
- Store links as typed_connections (relation_type='references')
- Query can traverse link graph for related docs

tasks.title: Memory consolidation suggestions
tasks.description:
Analyze memories to suggest consolidation opportunities:

1. Find memories with high term overlap (similar topics)
2. Identify repeated concepts across multiple entries
3. Suggest creating concept documents from clusters
4. Track 'memory age' - old unconsolidated memories

Algorithm:
- Use existing Louvain clustering on memory documents
- Memories in same cluster = consolidation candidates
- High PageRank terms across cluster = concept name

Output:
- 'These 5 memories all discuss PageRank, consider creating concepts/pagerank.md'
- 'Memory from 2025-12-10 has 80% overlap with 2025-12-14, merge?'

CLI: python scripts/suggest_consolidation.py

tasks.title: Session handoff memory generator
tasks.description:
Generate memory documents for agent session continuity:

When ending a session, create a handoff document containing:
1. What was accomplished (from completed tasks)
2. Current state (uncommitted changes, running processes)
3. Blockers or issues encountered
4. Suggested next steps
5. Key context the next session needs

Integration:
- Hook into session end (or manual trigger)
- Pull from task retrospectives
- Include git status summary
- Link to relevant code locations

Format: memories/session-handoff-YYYY-MM-DD-HHMM.md

This enables smooth continuation across agent sessions
and builds institutional memory of development flow.

tasks.title: Make memory/decision filenames merge-safe
tasks.description:
Apply the same merge-safe pattern from tasks to memories and decisions.

Current patterns (can conflict):
- memories: YYYY-MM-DD-topic.md
- decisions: adr-NNN-title.md

Proposed patterns (merge-safe):
- memories: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS_XXXX-topic.md
- decisions: adr-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-XXXX-title.md

Changes needed:
1. Update memory-manager skill templates
2. Update /knowledge-transfer command
3. Update docs/text-as-memories.md examples
4. Add helper: scripts/new_memory.py with auto-generated safe names
5. Add helper: scripts/new_decision.py with auto-generated safe names

Alternative: Use topic-hash suffix instead of timestamp
Example: 2025-12-14-dogfooding-a1b2.md

The session ID approach mirrors the proven task system design.
